title: spec: `go build` accepts \f and \v as whitespace, but http://golang.org/ref/spec doesn't list them as whitespace
body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Try to compile http://play.golang.org/p/KIE2ZGRY4j (there's a \f / ^L between
"var" and "a", and a \v / ^K between "var" and
"b")

The spec says """White space, formed from spaces (U+0020), horizontal
tabs (U+0009), carriage returns (U+000D), and newlines (U+000A), is ignored
except"â€¦""

What is the expected output?

Error message about "var^Kb" not being a valid token

What do you see instead?

It builds fine. Either go should error out, or the spec should be updated.


Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?

`go build`. I think that's 6g?


Which operating system are you using?

OS X


Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')

go version devel +126c37a9e33c Fri Nov 02 16:17:34 2012 -0700


Please provide any additional information below.
Attachments: 1. tst.go (32 bytes)
